title: 2.2 Master Challenge 3
question:
The Caesar cipher, or shift cipher, is a simple substitution cipher where letter positions in a word shift by a certain number. In this encryption method, each letter in the message is replaced by the letter a certain number of positions down the alphabet. For example, shifting each letter by 2 places, A becomes C, and B becomes D.
Program a solution to input a string in uppercase without spaces or special characters. The software should apply the shift, following specified rules, and output the encoded string using the Caesar cipher.
Tips
● ord(char) returns the ASCII value of a character.
● chr(value) returns a character corresponding to a specific ASCII value.
● For any given input character char (upper case), the line given below prints the respective character after shifting it to the specified value.
